Great authentic hunan food. Spicy.

We ordered the Steamed Fish Head with Chilies and the Classic Chairman Mao's Braised Pork. The fish was perfectly tender and the spicy sauce was complex and addictiveâ€”fiery but not just about heat. The pork belly melted in our mouths; it was rich, slightly sweet, and beautifully balanced.

I've been searching for authentic Hunan cuisine since I moved here, and I've finally found my holy grail. This place is incredible! The food is bursting with the bold, fiery, and aromatic flavors that Hunan cuisine is famous for

Amazing Garlic Pork Ribs â€” Crispy, Flavorful, and Perfectly Cooked!
These garlic pork ribs are absolutely incredible! The ribs are fried to perfection â€” crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside. They're coated with crunchy fried garlic that adds a burst of aroma with every bite. As soon as you take a bite, the rich garlic flavor fills your mouth, blending perfectly with the tender and flavorful meat inside.
The seasoning is spot-on, and the texture is just right â€” not too greasy, not too dry. Definitely a must-try for garlic lovers!
Highly recommend giving these a try. You wonâ€™t be disappointed!

The restaurant boasts a truly unique and stylish ambiance, making every corner incredibly photogenicâ€”perfect for snapping those memorable shots. The service was exceptionally warm and attentive, going above and beyond to make our visit special. We brought our little one along for a family gathering, and they even surprised us with a lovely toy, which absolutely made our childâ€™s day. Our whole family absolutely adored the experienceâ€”we canâ€™t wait to come back!
å¾ˆæ­£å®—çš„æ¹–å—èœï¼Œè¿‘æœŸåœ¨çº½çº¦åƒçš„æœ€æœ€æ»¡æ„çš„ä¸€æ¬¡æ­£å®—ä¸­é¤ã€‚çƒ¤é±¼çš„å‘³é“éå¸¸å…¥å‘³ã€‚é…èœçš„å‘³é“ä¹Ÿè¶…çº§æ£’ã€‚å¾ˆæ»¡æ„çš„ç”¨é¤ä½“éªŒï¼Œä»¥åè¿˜ä¼šå†æ¥ã€‚

Hunan restaurants in NYC are harder to find than a Republican at Burning Man, so when I came across Young and Rich as a lunch contender, I was skeptical there'd actually be authentic (and good) Hunan dishes. But there were, and I was more than happy to be wrong.

The black Fried Stinky Tofu was delightfully musky and pungent, though nowhere near as stinky as its Taiwanese cousin (as is typical). Definitely get this for dining mates who've always wanted to try stinky tofu but need a "training wheels" version to start.

The Sauteed Prawns with Garlic and Vermicelli were gloriously crunchy and juicy, while the Griddle Spicy Bullfrog Pot was classic Hunan in a stew--from the chewy frog meat to the delicious green peppers. Similarly, the Stir-Fried Beef Hunan Style hit all the right regional notes. And the House Special Fish Head with Hunan Pepper--while taking an extra 45 min to prepare--was worth the wait for the mouth-tender fish and delicate spice, so similar yet so different from its bombastic Sichuan cousin.

Service was pretty easy and attentive throughout, and the decor was modern and clean.

This spot is a nice choice if atmosphere is what youâ€™re after, since the vibe is warm and inviting. However, the food left me a bit underwhelmed. I came early in the morning hoping for authentic Hunan flavors, but the spicy beef tasted just okay and felt like it had been premade. The seasoning seemed overly processed, with a chemical aftertaste that wasnâ€™t very pleasant on the palate or the stomach. While it wasnâ€™t terrible, it definitely didnâ€™t deliver the fresh, bold flavors I was hoping for.

Stumbled upon this Hunan restaurant in Flushing â€” the food was a great surprise! The Stir-fried Beef with Chili was flavorful and tender with just the right kick of spice. The Steamed Egg with Minced Pork was silky and savory, and the Golden Crispy Corn was sweet, crispy, and addictive. The vibe in the restaurant was also great, and the owner has really good taste in music. Will definitely come back!

Highly recommend this hidden Hunan restaurant in Flushing! The stir-fried beef with chili is perfectly cookedâ€”spicy, flavorful, and incredibly tender. The steamed egg with minced pork is silky and savory, making it the perfect match with rice. The golden crispy corn is crunchy on the outside, tender on the inside, and so sweet you canâ€™t stop eating it! Whatâ€™s even more fun is the ownerâ€™s great taste in musicâ€”enjoying delicious food with great tunes made the whole vibe perfect. If you love Hunan cuisine, donâ€™t miss this placeâ€”itâ€™s the kind of spot youâ€™ll want to come back to again and again!

Great experience at Young and Rich! The food was authentic and full of flavor. The Mei Cai Kou Rou was tender and rich, the stir-fried pork with chili had the perfect balance of spice and smokiness, and the stinky tofu was crispy on the outside and soft inside, with a strong but delicious aroma. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, and the service was friendly. Highly recommended for anyone who loves Hunan cuisine!

Great authentic Hunan restaurant! The food is spicy and full of flavor. Loved the chili pork and cumin beef. Service was fast and friendly. Highly recommend if you like real Chinese spice! Will be back soon.

Great delicious and fresh!

Can be a bit on the saltier side for some dishes but definitely a great find in town.

The dishes are beyond my expectations and I was blown away by the sour cabbage fish and boiled fish. The sauces compliments so much with the fattiness of the fish, and I had to order another to-go. Spicy and addicting.
Other great dishes include Maoâ€™s braised pork (melting in the month texture), the coated corns (sweet, crunchy, and salty!), and their new dish stinky tofu (yummy with the sauces!!!)

Absolutely recommend to people who have a spicy cravings.

It has been a year since our last visit to Young and Rich and we miss their Salted Egg Yolk Veggies. Their decor is bright, clean and wide-spaced which is family & kids friendly.

We shared a total 6 dishes for a group of four and the portion was proper with reasonable price. Itâ€™s overall decent but very spicy for the dishes with chili warning  mark on menu.

My roommate loves their Smashed Chilies w. Preserved Egg, refreshing and flavorful but extremely spicy.

Steamed Eggplant w. Salted Egg Yolk is the reason we visited. Itâ€™s extremely delicious. The eggplant was soft & juicy and the salted egg crumble on the top was satisfying. Itâ€™s a sinful dish and I need to do more exercise after having it.
